rukus.text: Do you not see that We have sicked Satan on the unbelievers to incite them with fury
So do not rush them, for We count out for them a number
The day We will gather the righteous to God, the Merciful Benefactor, as a dependent
And We will drive those who are corrupt to hell, like thirsty livestock driven down to water
None will have the power of intercession except those who received permission from God, the Merciful Benefactor
They say, “God, the Merciful Benefactor, has a son.”
Indeed you have put forward a thing most atrocious
At this the skies are ready to burst, the earth to split asunder, and the mountains to fall down in utter ruin
That they should invoke a son for God, the Merciful Benefactor
For it is not consistent with the majesty of God, the Merciful Benefactor, that He should have a son
Not one of the beings in the heavens and the earth come to God, the Merciful Benefactor, except as a servant
He takes account of them all, and has numbered them all exactly
And every one of them will come to Him alone on the Day of Accountability
On those who believe and do deeds of righteousness, God the Merciful Benefactor, will bestow love
We have made it easy in your own tongue, that with it you may give hope to the righteous, and warnings to people given to hostility
But how many generations before them have We caused to perish? Can you find a single one of them, or hear so much as a whisper of them
